sn40.1:0.3: A Question About the First jhāna
sn40.1:1.1: At one time Venerable Mahāmoggallāna was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn40.1:1.2: There Venerable Mahāmoggallāna addressed the bhikkhus:
sn40.1:2.1: “Just now, reverends, as I was in private retreat this thought came to mind:
sn40.1:2.2: ‘They speak of this thing called the “first jhāna”.
sn40.1:2.5: ‘It’s when a bhikkhu, quite secluded from sensuality, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first jhāna, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
sn40.1:2.6: This is called the first jhāna.’
sn40.1:2.7: And so … I was entering and remaining in the first jhāna.
sn40.1:2.8: While I was in that meditation, perceptions accompanied by sensuality beset me due to loss of focus.
sn40.1:3.1: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,
sn40.1:3.3: Don’t neglect the first jhāna, brahmin! Settle your mind in the first jhāna; unify your mind and immerse it in the first jhāna.’
sn40.1:3.4: And so, after some time … I entered and remained in the first jhāna.
sn40.1:3.5: So if anyone should be rightly called
sn40.1:3.6: a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with help from the Teacher, it’s me.”
